titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William Alexander (1808-1875) was a Philadelphia-born poet and graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, where he studied under Professor S. B. Wylie. His book of poetry and essays, The Poetical Works of William Alexander Including His Christiad, Dramas, and Minor Poems with Dissertations on Poetry and a Sketch of His Life, was published by Lippincott in 1847.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes of works by William Alexander given to the Athenaeum by the author. The first volume is a collection of minor poems dated 1855, the second volume is a manuscript presentation copy of the Christiad dated 1859. The Christiad volume also includes "Inez de Castro, a Tragedy," and an engraving of Alexander.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Library Company of Philadelphia: William Alexander essays, 1859.
